document.docAuthor: Molina, Óscar S. & Gil-Azevedo, Leonardo H.
document.masterDocTitle: Simulium (Trichodagmia) (Diptera, Simuliidae) phylogeny revisited: the Neotropical and Afrotropical connection

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Simulium (Trichodagmia) (Diptera, Simuliidae) phylogeny revisited: the Neotropical and Afrotropical connection

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Instituto Oswaldo Cruz - IOC / Fiocruz, Laboratório de Simulídeos e Oncocercose (LSO / IOC- Fiocruz), Coleção de Simulídeos do IOC - CSIOC / Fiocruz, Referência Nacional em Simulídeos, Oncocercose e Mansonelose, Av. Brazil, 4.365, Rio de Janeiro, RJ, Brazil.
Departamento de Entomologia. Museu Nacional-Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro, Quinta da Boa Vista s / n, 20940 - 040, São Cristóvão, Rio de Janeiro, RJ, Brazil.

Hagenomyia Shewell, 1959: 83
, figs 1–9 (as subgenus of
Simulium
) (preoc.). Type species:
Simulium pictipes Hagen, 1880
. nom. praeoc.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Shewellomyia Peterson, 1975: 111 (as subgenus of
Simulium
). Type species:
Simulium pictipes Hagen, 1880
. nom. nov.

bibRefCitation.author: Adler P. H.
bibRefCitation.refString: Adler P. H. 1990. Two new species of black flies (Diptera: Simuliidae) from North America. Proceedings of the Entomological Society of Washington 92: 431 - 443. Available from https: // www. biodiversitylibrary. org / part / 63957 [accessed 19 Aug. 2021].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Simulium ( Shewellomyia )
was recovered as monophyletic and stable, based on three synapomorphies ( Fig. 1 , Table 2 , node 7), therefore we propose its revalidation.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Simulium ( Shewellomyia )
is distributed in the Nearctic Region, recorded from the central-eastern regions of Canada and the USA ( Adler 2020 ).
